summary: The 'Protecting Firefighters and Advancing State-of-the-Art Alternatives Act' (H.R. 3184) aims to drive innovation in firefighter protection by accelerating the development of PFAS-free turnout gear. The bill authorizes grants for research, development, and testing of next-generation turnout gear, focusing on PFAS-free components. It also mandates training programs for firefighters on best practices for safe gear use and decontamination. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is tasked with submitting a report to Congress on the progress made. Funding is authorized for research and training programs through 2029 and 2031, respectively.
